intro: Adenanthos barbiger, commonly known as the hairy adenanthos, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, glandular hairs. Adenanthos barbiger is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments.
